cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, then expected to curve northwest toward the Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and ultimately toward South Florida and the southeastern United States

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Cuba from Matanzas eastward to Guantanamo; Central Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, N coast of Dominican Republic & Haiti, SE Bahamas and Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands westward through Bahamas, Cuba, Florida peninsula, and portions of the southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 26% chance of 34-kt (gale) winds and 10% chance of 50-kt winds at the port between 4–5 days from now
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Irma tracks closer to the South Carolina coast, minor to moderate surge above 3 ft is possible, especially with onshore flow
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands associated with Irma’s outer circulation could bring 4‒8 in of rain early next week, leading to flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend ahead of the storm
